text: Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Flasche gekauft bei Craftbeer-Shop.de
Gelber Bernstein, trüb, wenig Schaum
Hopfen, Malzsüsse, fruchtig (Zitrus) 
Sprudelnder Antrunk
Über den typischen Pilsgeschmack, der vorhanden ist, liegt eine sanfte Mildheit, die es angenehm macht. Zudem leicht fruchtig. Südfrucht, Grapefruit, aber moderat. Bitter im Gaumen. 
Vielschichtiges und sehr gutes Pils

Bottle poured into Spiegelau IPA Glass. Pours clear yellow with huge white head. Nose is fresh herbal, slightly malty. Taste refreshing herbal to grassy, Green tea. Finish Kind of bitter. Best Pilsener in a Long time.
Couleur jaune dorée, petite mousse. Nez leger houblonné fruité. Gout malt dorge avec houblon fruité un peu vieux fruits. Bon corps. Fin maltée un peu miel et houblonnée fruitée. Moyenne, suis décu .

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Flesje van Craft beer Lobberich. Bleekgeel, mooie kraag. Smaakt grassig, hoppig, fris. Ruikt niet heel sterk, maar met wat moeite en als het bier wat warmer wordt dan ruik ik  hop, vanille, zoet fruit, koekjes. Lekkere pils.
0,33l Flasche. Tiefgelbes Pils mit toller Schaumkrone. Angenehmes Aroma nach Malz und frischem Hopfen. Auch im Geschmack sehr gut abgestimmt, mit Nuancen nach Circus, Gras und Heu.

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks for this one. BB 04.11.2017. almost clear yellow color, medium big white head. smells of tobacco, lightly citric, grassy, light chlorophyl, bit breadish. nice smell. medium body, prickly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes grassy, tobacco, rather cheewy, doughy, some light fruity notes, bit peppery, lightly citric. finishes lightly bitter with notes of grass, tobacco and some breadish notes. quite nice one, great balance.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. Best before april 2017. Christmas gift from SecretSanta ! Thank you. A pale golden light opaque beer with a big white head ; medium retention ; good lacing. Light herb, dusty grain, vegetable notes. Light to medium dry bitter refreshing, light sweet. Light body, thin texture, good carbonation, dry bitter refreshing finish. Overall, meh ; refreshing but definitely rough around the edges. Disappointing right now : I think I am missing something... I will have to re-rate this one.
Almost clear, golden colour, nice head. Aroma: hoppy; floral, grassy, some fruits. Medium body, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Quite clean profile, bit of fruits, flavour focused on hoppy side.

Bottle. Clear golden colour, nice white head. Lightly herbal but mainly bready, malty aroma followed but nice crisp, bit bready taste with herbal note and bitter hoppy and dry finish. Really good German pils.
14.01.2017 - the advanced version of their already well made pils. Good pils base with fresh hoppy floral to herbal aroma.

0,33l Flasche. Gelbes Bier, schöner weisser Schaum. Kraftvoller Duft. Blumenwiese, Vanille, Zitrone, Beeren und ganz viel Hopfen. Frischer Pilsgeschmack. Citrus, Kräuter, Hopfen. Toller bitterer Abgang. Langer Nachhall. Der frische Hopfen ist wunderbar präsent.
Helles klares gelb schaum ok, Geruch sehr komplex nach Blumenwiese kraäutergarten fruchtige süße Hauch Vanille, Geschmack toll frisch hopfig kräuterig angenehm herb, schönes bier
Riecht nach Zitronenmelisse und frischem Gras. Start grasig, zitronig, Minze. Florale Mitte, Zitronenmelisse. Moderat malzig, bitterwürziger Abgang. Gutes Bier.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4, many thanks! Pours clear pale golden with a big shortlived head. Aroma is a little fruity, but still the non-aroma hops with the lager touch of malt are more notable. Body is medium, fresh, almost tart, with a lively carbonation, shining with hops (both through bitterness and flavours). Pleasure to drink this.
Okropna warka. W aromacie trawa, łodyga, granulat, intensywnie i niezbyt zachęcająco. W smaku trawiasto - ziemiście, granulatowo, goryczka wysoka, długa. Nie orzeźwia.

Aroma: herbal, orange, grass, some grain
Taste: light bitter, herbal, grass, grain

Butelka 0,33l. Aromat słodowy, trochę ziołowy, przyjemny. Klarowne złoto, ładna piana. Ze szkła jakby nuty kanalizacyjne. W smaku bardzo przyjemne, słodowe, z delikatną, ziołową chmielowością. Goryczka umiarkowana.
Interesting and nice hoppy taste. For the lasting aftertaste and mouthfeel it gets some bonuspoints.
Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, hay, meadow flowers, dried flowers. Hoppy flavour, light bitter, malts. Light bitter finish, floral, elderflower. Nice!!(from 33cL bottle @ home)

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden color with nice white head. Aroma is juicy grassy, floral and earthy hops. Taste is buttery, grassy, biscuity malts, bitter-earthy finish. A touch of the unfiltered yeastiness also shines through. Low to medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel. The juicy hoppiness and oily mouthfeel remind me of two of my favourite Lagers, Ayinger Jahrhundert from the Holzfass and Ayinger Zwickel. This Pils is just way more bitter in the back. Amazing brew!

Typical pils. The bitternes is not to strong but you feel it long.
Fresh and lemon taste...

Swietny Pilsner. Zadko zdarza mi się tak wysoko ocenic Pilsnera i wogole piwo dolnej fermenracji. Ale zasluzylo to piwo na to. Zapach cytryny, dość ostry, w smaku cytryna i lekka kwaskowosc limonki, goryczka tak jak lubie, konkretna i wyrazista a przy tym na długo pozostaje w ustach. Piana sniezno biala trwala i spora, jaskrawo zolta barwa lekko mgliste i niefiltrowane, naturalne piwo. Wspaniale na afrykańskie upaly, ale i do ostrej pikantnej kuchni. Rasowy Pilsner polecam.

Bottled (from BZ). Yellowish golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is nicely herbal, floral and fruity with some mild bready and toffeeish notes as well as some earth. Flavour is herbal, grassy, floral and some mild wooden notes along with some nice sweet maltiness balancing it up. Mellow fine bitterness in the finish. Very refreshing and tasty.

33cl Bottle from REWE Stenten. Hazy golden yellow colour, dense rocky white head. Aroma of bright lemon sherbet, lemon candy, lemon peel, hay, light malty. Flavour is malty, lemon, lemon sherbet, grass, light yeasty, nice and hoppy bitter finish, light spicy. Light bodied. Great pils, wish I bought more.

(draught at BKL 2013 & bottle, 33cl at home) Hazy, pale golden colour with a big, blond and persistent foamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with herbal resiny and mildly citrus-fruity notes with cautious yeasty spice and pale malt in the background. Moderately bitter flavour, light bodied with a crisp, well-carbonated mouthfeel. Aromatic hops profile upfront with herbal, resiny and fruity accents, backed by a soft pale malty base; lingering resiny, herbal and subtle fruity finish. Wonderful. 08.III.13 & 05.III.16

27-Feb-2016-0,33L Flasche @MühlenBar. Goldgelb, klar, weisser Schaum.
Aroma grasig, minimal moderig. Antrunk frisch, grasig hopfig.
Helles goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, hopfig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Grapefruit, blumig, grasig, spritzig.
Buona davvero. Pericolosamente dissetante. Amaro finale lungo e piacevolissimo.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Hell, leicht grünlich und trüb. Geruch nach Wiese und Hopfen. Im Geschmack dann klar grüner Hopfen. Schlank, trocken, Zum Ende bitter, der grüne Geschmack hängt nach.
Flasche - Gelbes Bier mit stabiler, dicker Schaumkrone. Duft nach Zitrus und feuchtem Gras. Im Geschmack fruchtig, floral, bevor der herbe Vorschlaghammer einsetzt. So sollte ein Pils schmecken!

Pale golden colored, medium to strong white puffy head, nice lacing. Aroma is malty grains and moderate- herbal hops. Taste is low to medium sweet malt, grains, cereal, noble and herbal fresh hops, medium- bitterness, dry finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

Wirklich tolles Pils.
Wunderbar frisches Hopfenaroma sowohl in der Nase als auch im Geschmack. Das Malz bildet ein wunderbares Grundgerüst und der Körper ist sehr gut für ein Pils. Der Hopfen ist grasig, würzig, leicht fruchtig.
Super!
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy weak grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy finish.
En god fyldig pilsner. Der er smag af humle og en anelse græs i smagen. den har ikke syrlige smag nogle pilsnere har.
bottle. Golden yellow, mid-sized white head. Grassy-resiny hop aroma. Light and elegant malty base delivering aromatic and quite fragrant fresh, green hops.

0,33 l bottle bought at Grebhan´s, Bremen. Pale yellow in the glass, small white foamy head.Grain and hop on the nose, little bit citrus. Taste starts hopy, little bit skunky. Grain in the second row. Strange bitter middle part. Didn´t work for me this night.

Bottiglia da 33 cl. Biondo chiaro, limpidissima; schiuma bianca, pannosa, poco persistente. Al naso aromi di malto, poi floreali del luppolo, erbacei, leggeri agrumi, con finale di lievito. In bocca è molto pulita, il malto è subito contrastato da un bilanciatissimo amaro erbaceo e resinoso, molto robusto che persiste nel finale moderatamente lungo. Corpo basso, carbonazione media. Pils veramente ben fatta, equilibrata e ben strutturata.

Flasche 33cl. Wunderbare Schaumkrone, blumig-grasige Hopfen in der Nase. Im Mund dann Hopfenalarm! Sauber gemacht, der Grünhopfen ist wirklich gut eingefangen. Exzellent, derzeit keine Konkurrenz in Sicht!
Golden colour, perfectly clear. Big, white head with lacing. Sweet malty aroma some grass and hops. Taste is also clear and malty with some hops and low herbal bitterness.
Bottle.Golden colour with white fluffy head.Aroma of fresh citrus and hops,fresh crispy taste with mild spicey mouth feels hint of grass and nice fresh finish.

330 ml bottle at Les Vignerons. Bright gold, slightly hazy, with an average and persistent white head. Good lacing. True explosion of dank, weedy, almost cheesy, wet fresh hop notes. Perhaps not the most clean and refined aroma, but pretty inviting nonetheless. Decent grassy and bready presence too. Same impressions in the mouth: grassy and herbal, slightly more hopped than a traditional pilsner, moderate and lingering bitterness. Average carbonation, medium body, creamy texture. Perhaps one dimensional but not bad at all.

Flasche (33 cl) von Getränkefeinkost, Berlin-Friedrichshain. - Hellgelb, leicht trüb; schöner Schaum. - Sehr aromatische Hopfennase mit herber Zitrusfrucht (Grapefruit), Gras, Harz und Blumen (Rose?). - Weicher Antrunk mit intensiven Hopfenaromen: grasig, blumig, krautig, hopfenwürzig und zitronig. Dazu mildes helles Malz, Weißbrot, ein Hauch von Süße. Mild rezent, hefeweiches Mundgefühl. Gut hopfenherber, trockener Abgang, langer aromatisch bitterer Nachtrunk mit Grapefruit oder unreifem Obst. - Enorm aromatisch gehopftes Pilsener, dabei gar nicht besonders bitter oder wuchtig. Einziges Manko ist der etwas schroffe Nachtrunk.

Draught at Braukunst Live München 2015.
Beautiful appearance! Golden shining, consistently hazy body, with a massive, stable, frothy to creamy, snow white head.
Fresh aroma of hay, fresh grass, flowers, sweet bread, citrus and loads of other fruits from the background.
Taste follows this, with additional bitter herbs, reminding you this is still a Pilsener.
Medium, quite oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes bitter, quite dry, with grass, herbs, flowers and subtle sweet malts.

Wow, what a surprise! This is by far the best Pilsener Ive had and I never thought I would ever rate a beer of this style that high! A perfectly accomplished Lager beer, pretty complex, with loads of fresh, lovely aromas and still very quaffable and easy to drink.

Bottle via trade with Koels, shared with Paul. Pours a bright lemon orange body with thick white head and lacing which lasts throughout. Aroma is clean malt, crisp cereal, lemon and fresh-cut grass. Mouthfeel is bright and carbonated - almost reminds me of a non-brett version of Stillwaters Premium. Really clean and drinkable pilsner - and one of the best in recent memory.

Bouteille de 330 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie (Montréal, QC) au coût 5,35$. Arôme: Légère odeur dhoublons avec une pointe fruitée. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe de citron. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #6177)

Ein feines Pils... Gießt sehr helles Gelb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone ein, die gute Spuren hinterlässt. Aromen von Limette, Grapefruit und etwas Seife. Schön herb im Antrunk und im Körper, wird allmählich süßer, langes, trockenes Ende.

330ml bottle. Minimally hop-hazy, yellow-ish golden colour with average to huge, fluffy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, snow-white head. Grassy and slightly fruity, hoppy aroma, hints of mirabelle, floral, yeasty overtones. Taste is grassy and minimally citrusy hoppy, hints of mirabelle and apricot, crisp bitterness; soft, creamy palate, gentle carbonation. Very fine.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 Traditional pils produced using Hallertauer And Spalter hops. The purity law is obviously respect as well as the decotion mashing system.

0,33 l bottle from P&M Getränke, best before 6/11/2015. Clear, pale golden yellow with a big, frothy to creamy, slowly diminishing, white head. Nice, citrusy but weak aroma of lemon, fresh cut grass and hay. Fresh, slightly bitter taste of lemon, fresh cut grass and hay with hints of biscuits. Crisp, slightly bitter and aromatic finish. Thin body, fresh mouthfeel, flat carbonation. Very refreshing and highly drinkable. Not as hoppy as expected but still very aromatic. Enjoyable!

Sehr speziell, da es doch an ein wenig IPA angelehnt ist mit einer feinen Hopfung, diesen Zitrusnuancen und dennoch bietet es daneben noch die milde Buttrigkeit eines Hellen und einer ebenso milden Bitterkeit des Pils. Ausgewogen, solide, süffig - meins.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a clear deep golden colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of fresh hops and unripe fruits. Taste of unripe, yet intense hops, citrus fruits, grass. Bitter finish with a light dry touch. Enjoyed it.

Clear(didnt serve yeast) yellow to golden color, amazing dense head, lasting. Aroma of noble hops and some grainy sweet maltiness, hops are earthy and flowery. Not as bitter as I would expect a pilsner would be and not much aftertaste.
Not very intense in general but very pure, it reminded me of my last homebrewed lager. Solid brew.

Dieses trübe. hellgebliche Bier besticht durch ein feines, wohlbalanciertes Hopfenaroma in der Nase. Dieses findet sich noch verstärkt im Mund wieder. Das Bier ist pilstypisch sehr schlank gehalten, was ihm auch sehr gut steht.
Besonders hoch ist die fein abgestimmte, nicht überproportionale Hopfengabe zu bewerten.

Bottle. Hazy citrus-yellow body with medium white head. Aroma has floral tones, light citrus. Pretty far from a pilsner, but luckly were not judging to the style. Taste has high earthy bitterness, medium malty sweetness. Body is full, medium carbonation. Pretty nice.

Une petite bouteille. Surprenante bière avec des houblons verts mais très agréable. Il y a du citron. La date pourrait en rebutée plusieurs mais elle semble très fraîche (11,11,14). Un beau produit. Jaimerais en boire une fraichement sortie de la brasserie.

Nice bitterish full-flavored pils, the sort of which there ought to be more. Hazy gold with OK foam stability. Earthy-leafy hop aroma backed by mild sweet grain. Firm refreshing bitterness, herbal-lemony, but not over the top, some resin and soapy aftertaste.

Quite clear, light golden colour, Fine firm head. Fresh floral and grasy aroma. Fresh taste, subtle grassy hop notes. Medium body, medium carbonation. Elegant bitterness. light and fresh finish. Fantastic summer beer.

Bottle from Birratrovo, Como; bb 11.11.14Blond color; steady head. There is some malt and hops in the aroma, but its quite light, and it shows also some cereals. The flavor is more interesting, with quite solid crispy malt and hops that show a grassy side; strong bitterness.Nice.

Couleur paille avec une belle petite tête blanche qui saccroche. Au nez, la céréale pils est étonnamment en forme et croquante tandis que les houblons qui sont aussi étonnants fabriquent des arômes dherbes et des parfums citronnés. En bouche, cest frais malgré lâge. Ça goûte le zeste de citron et la petite feuille de menthe. Crime, je suis surpris! Au palais, le corps est svelte et bien pétillant. En finale, lherbe est sèche et est arrosée par du citron! Si facile à boire. Meilleure avant le 11.11.14? Solide produit. Définitivement.
Bottle. Pour is with a head, aroma is earthy, bitter, floral. Taste is fruity, earthy, solid bitterness, light-bodied and smooth carbonation, thick texture and a mild bitter finish. Very good pils

Yellow, hazy beer with a nice head. The aroma is floral and hoppy. It tastes deliciously hoppy without being bitter. There is a nice touch of dry grapefruit in it. Absolutely refreshing and delicious. The finish is a bit dry and bitter. Perfectly balanced.

Aroma: herbs, some floral notes with citrus.
Appearance: hazy lemon color, white head.
Taste: high bitterness (citrus notes like pomelo, grapefruit), citrus and herbal notes, heather, nice malty backbone, some honey notes, really refreshing and tasty.
Palate: low body and high carbonation (beer was overcarbonated), bitter finish.
Overall: The best Pils Ive ever tried. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale pils with a nice pure white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of clean cereal notes with light dry hoppy notes. Taste of cereal is quite clean with no unrefined grainy notes and a light leafy hops dry finish. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. Well brewed with nice drinkability that would be even better if drank at the source.

330ml bottle, slight cloudy pale golden hue, with a big pillowy withe head, nice cut hay, faint mineral water, bread dough nose, with a mild floral herbal leafy, grassy hop, faint vanilla note, and a subtle grainy pale, pilsener malt accent in the aroma follows through on a light-bodied palate with a crisp, subtle citrus peel, delicate flowery citrus, leafy hop, faint bread dough character, with a subtle mint leaf, crunchy pale, pilsener grainy malt cereal flavour, leading towards a light clean lingering citrus, leafy dry hop bitterness finish.
Had it on tap ....very refreshing with an amazing crisp character and a refreshing hop flavor....very enjoyable...

Bottle shared at Chrisos post GBBF minidig, 16/08/14.
Clear pale golden with moderate off white spotting and edgework.
Nose is pale malt, straw, light citrics, orange.
Taste comprises cereal, pale malt, bready notes, light citric wash.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, semi drying close.
Adequate pils but no game changer.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at ChrisO. Hazy pale yellow, small to average sized white head. Smell and taste malts, bitter hops, bitter, quite strongly hay and straw. Quite well bodied actually, with average to medium carbonation.

Aroma:Good citrus nose...
Appearance:Cloudy yellow,light lacing white head..
Flavor:good citrus flavor,dry....
Bottle - Grains and some earthy hops. Cloudy gold with a thin white head. Fruity and bitter right up front with a biscuit and then very clean finish.

My Bottom Line:
Zesty citrus, herbal lengths and bread crumbs whirl about in this fluffy, unfiltered Pilsener.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A foam cumulus leaves patches all around the pint glass, decorating the cloudy straw blond.
-Corn-like angles are imagined here and there.
-Herbal hop bitterness balances out the finish.
-Mouthfeel is pleasantly dry and bubbles are plump.
-Trou du Diables lagers are very much in the same mold.
-Drinkability is really high, as expected.
-I am impressed by the condition of this beer having gone through Quebecs import system (private import, but still through the SAQ monopoly) with nary a scratch. Its best by date, in November, may point to the brewers high confidence in his product as well....

Bottles.
Cloudy yellow color with beautiful head. Aroma is citrus hops. Flavor is hops, citrus, bitter. Really great pils!

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 11/2014. Pours slightly unclear pale golden in color with a foamy whitish head. Lemon and dry hay hits you instantly in aroma. Somewhat bitter in taste, lemon and grainy notes as well.

Bottle in a hotel room in Berlin.
Cloudy golden colored with a medium sized lacing white head.
Malty aroma of hay, hops and grass.
Malty flavor of hay, hops and grass with notes of citrus
Hoppy finish.

Bottled. Pale yellow coloured. Hazy. Off white Dense head. Aroma. Grass, herbs, light sweetness, hay. Flavour. Grass, herbs, sweetness, some citrus and lemonade. Medium bodied. Grassy bitter end with a citric dry touch.
Pours a clear golden color with full white head. Aromas of grain and light fruity. Light bitter finish.
Bottle 33 CL. Pours light hazy yellow with white lacing head. Really intense grass notes. Caramel, hay, grass.- beerbasher
Bottle. Yellow, unfiltered. Hoppy, grassy greens, subtle fruityness. Bitter, med light bodied. Nice pils. Hoppy, pale malty. Ol.-- bb

Bottle: Hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is hoppy with grassy, flowerly and light fruity notes. Flavor is light malty with malty fruitiness and a hint of sweetness, nice hop notes of pine, citrus peel, grass, herbs. Medium bitter, dry finish. Nice balanced.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Clear golden. One finger well lasting foam. Pronounced hoppy pine green fresh grass. Weak malty notes. Some DMS. Low bitterness but bone- dry. The Best pils in a long long time.

Draught in Browariat. Wow, this one is literally loaded with hops. It feels like hop juice, like hop resins mixed with grass extract and then pured into a pils. Or like sucking on a hop pellet. Floral, herbal, light lemony. This might be the most hoppy pils Ive ever had. It could be slightly improved though, making the hoppiness come across less perfumy.
Bottle from bier-deluxe.de. Hazy pale golden color with thick white head. Herbal and citrus hops in aroma. Taste, malt, spicy hops, lemon in background. Long light hoppy bitterness in finish. OK.

A- Pours a clear, yellow hue with a large, off white head. 

S- Yeast, lemon rind, hints of indistinct maltiness.

T- Hops up front, citrus, lemon rind, kumquat, yeasty on the back end.

M- Medium bodied with ample carbonation.

D- One of the best pilsners ive ever had. Love the fresh hops. Hoppy, light, refreshing.

Golden yellow beer, slightly haze with a decent white head. Aromas arent too present, wheat, grass and hints of lemon are detectable. 

Taste is much better than the smell of the beer, as it is defined by malt, wheat, straw, fresh cut grass and lemon peel, which adds a recognizable floral hop note. The beer has a decent complexity, and still remains being easy drinkable. Especially the noble hops stand out in this beer, as they go very well with the Pilsener character, while adding a well-focused, refreshing bitterness and subtle dry mouthfeel. Carbonation is very lively and supports the ligh session-character.

Bottle, BBE 11/11/14. Pours a translucent, slightly hale yellow with a large and thick, clean white head. Gorgeous. Aroma is a lot of grass and some flowers, some graininess there as well. Taste is very dry, quite bitter. Noble hops with grass and some floweriness dominate. Some grain beneath all the hops. Dries even more on the finish. Light and refreshing with strong carbonation. A very hop-forward pils.

33cl bottle pours with a crystal clear pale gold body that supports a fairly creamy near white head of foam that leaves behind some sheet lacing. The aroma offers up a dash of sugary candy malts and the it quickly gets to business with hoppy notes like soft lime citrus, spicy hops and a bit of flowery herb like floral hops. The taste is similar where it starts with a flash of neutral malt sweetness and a moment later modest lime citrus turns into a good dose of grapefruit bitter and flavor hops. To midway it picks up herbal and flowery hops that are on the bitter side and blended pretty well with the nearly tart grapefruit hop bitterness. This is light and refreshing and firm with hoppy bitter goodness from front to back. Due to the load of hops in this it doesnt seem all that Pils like but the great taste is hard to ignore so I wont. Nice beer.

(Keg at Das Meisterstück, Berlin, 20140422) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized, white and it lasted long. Aroma had grass and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, fruitiness, malts, grain and bitterness. Aftertaste was grainy and bitter. A pleasant pils.

330ml bottle. Hazy golden body, medium white head, decent retention. Aroma of fresh cut grass, slightly yeasty, coriander, hops. Taste: a very refreshing herbal hops bitterness, caramel malt, grapefruit zest. Its more like an APA.

aroma: grassy, hay, citrus, slighlty sour
appearance: hazy pale colour, decent foam
taste: hoppy (very hoppy), grassy, quite bitter, grapefruit, refreshing

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light herbalhoppyness. Body is medium, malty and dryish flavor, light - some herbal hoppyness. Finish is average, malty  lightly grainy and dryish, some grassy - herbal hoppyness. OK dryish and nicely hopped pils.

Floral noble hop aroma with malt hints. Hazy straw-gold with excellent white head that leaves lacing. Good german hop bitterness, hay, bread, floral, resiny taste. Light palate with high on-style carbonation. Dry finish. One of the best pilsners, no flaws.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 33cl bottle - bb11/2014, danke bastarda! Gentle start with a "young" malt aroma (white bread, some almond, hay), a subtle bottom fermenter that doesnt wear its wet hopping on its sleeve. Taste onset is gentle and easy as well, before quickly tilting into full grassy Hersbrücker territory, for a lingering back palate floral bitterness (pollen, dandelion) reminiscent of Poperings Hommelbier. Unfiltered, with smooth remnants of a yeast profile making for a mild and easy drinking experience despite the assertive late wet hop bitterness. Surely sessionable. // rerate from 33cl bottle bb09/2016, danke Michael, from BierFreunde Leipzig: lots of mint and basil leaves and chlorophyll, distinct vegetal and herbal bitters working in miniature unison on a just right "nettle milk" malt base.
Sehr schöne naturbelassene gelb/goldene Farbe. Schöne Krone. Florale, grasige Note zu Beginn, hopfenbetonte Note im Abgang. Nur zu empfehlen.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy pale yellow colour with a white lacy head. Aroma of fresh grassy hops, herbs and some maltiness. Very fresh flavour with strong grassy bitterness, mild citrusy notes, basil and a nice malty body. Medium bodied and a lingering bitter, dry and very grassy finish. Enjoyable and extremely quaffable. Great.

Un ottima pils..non perfetta ma di sicura qualità.bellissimo il cappello di schiuma ma poco persistente a mio avviso.
Equilibrata in bocca sprigiona subito laroma del luppolo fresco.
Bottled 33cl. Ordered from Bierzwerg. Very good pils. Great hop profile. Really enjoyed this pils

Bottle 0.33l. Pours clear golden yellow with white head. Aroma has grass, cereals, bread, hay. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet, dry, hops, slightly fruity. Aftertaste has a good bitterness and hop flavour. Very well balanced. Great Pils.

Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts fine hoppy and dry without being too much. Fine fruity like lemon, modest bitter background. Finish milder, less dry, still fine hoppy. Not bad!

Blond/yellow beer, with a nice head and rather sparkling.
The smell is rather faint. The taste is slightly bitter (with a citrus fruits taste?) but really refreshing.

330ml Flasche vom Bierzwerg. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit schöner großen Schaumkrone. Starke Karbonation. Geruch angenehm hopfig grasig. Geschmack angenehm hopfig, grasig, leichte fruchtig bitter, sehr gut.

The Bavaria stands at Berlins International Green Week get better every time I go: this year (2014) Private Landbrauerei Schönram had a bar within that area. I wandered over to it and had a draught one of these.

0.3 litre, slight haze to the yellow / golden body, white crown.

Hop nature to the aroma, as youd expect. Floral and grassy hints in the hoppy smell with a mild spicy undertone.

The taste wasnt as hoppy as I thought it would be, pleasant enough I suppose with the spicy hop notes coming through, but otherwise it just seemed like a normal Pilsner to me, a good one but nothing out of the ordinary.

Glad I tried it, plenty more beers to try out there though.

Yellow, clear, with a full, frothy head. Aroma of resiny hops, grass, hay and hints of citrus. Tastes fresh, floral and green/hoppy at first, then a medium bitterness with hints of malt. leaves hints of elderflowers on the tongue. Fresh, hoppy finish.

330 ml bottle. BB 11/11/14. From bierzwerg.de.
Cloudy yellow golden colour with a medium-sized white head. 
Very nice rubbery grassy hoppy aroma with dryness and some maltiness. Alluring. The flavour is a bit less than I expected after the delicious aroma but still rather nice. Dry grassy bitterness, some burning (like chili), moderate bitterness and some maltiness. This is quite nice. A bit thin.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 
Pours pale golden with a hint of haziness and sports a white head with big bubbles and good retention. The nose consists primarily of notes from orthodox German noble hops: floral, earthy, woody, spicy, and subtly citric; nice bouquet, but could be more intense. The flavor of the malt is white-bready up front. On the mid-palate, it gets steadily overwritten by the noble hops with all of the notes from the nose. The bitterness is sharply snappy and stays in the very clean finish along the bready barley malt; the malt which had been there all along, only being upstaged by the hops. The carbonation is above average for a pilsener, which is a welcome twist. Pretty damn decent pilsener.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Look: bright yellow and hazy with a white, medium, frothy to creamy head with and average retention. 

Aroma: quite hoppy, spicy herbal hops, but some citrus (lemon?) and flowers too, lollipop, some malty or yeasty notes in the background.

Taste: spicy and zesty hops, some sweeter notes - fruit/citrus, moderate bitterness that is soft and pleasant.

This is how pilseners should be.

Pale yellow cloudy body, thick head. Aroma grass, hay, grassy hops. Palate is mouthful, crispy, carbonation lively. Taste is grassy , herbal, hoppy and straightforward. Finish is dry , bitter and hoppy in style of Northern German pils. Honest and simple Pilsener, good full-bodied texture and clean with hints of Handwerk in there. Good stuff.

0,33 l bottle BB 11.11.14 
grass, hay, citrus, cereal, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Torbido color paglierino chiaro con un voluminoso e fragile cappello di schiuma bianca persistente. Aroma non molto intenso con note di fiori, malto, pane e limone; gusto mediamente amaro ed erbaceo, discretamente luppolato con note più dolciastre piacevolmente intense. Finale un po stucchevole e confuso, corpo lieve, debolmente effervescente, beverina. Una pils profumata e aromatica per nulla scipita, non eccelsa ma che sa distinguersi.
Ottima pils con grandissima bevibilitá abbinata ad una intensa luppolatura. Ideale come birra per aperitivo...
Leggermente dorata miele camomilla media secchezza buon amaro finale discreto erbaceo
Pils Pride 2013. Bunoa pils, secca e amara al punto giusto. Ben lontana dalle interpretazioni italiana dello stile. tra le tedesche tra le migliori!

(draught) pours a hazy golden-yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops, grass, light banana and heather, quite floral, with a hint of talcum powder. flavour is mostly the same, with prominent notes of straw and floral hops, also slightly yeasty. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle, 5%. Hazy golden with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops and grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grass, straw, little sweet and medium bitter.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Tapped: Golden, hazy,big stable off-white head, solid fresh herbal and also citrussy hoppy nose; moderate to solid bitter-sweet flavour, smooth MF, light bodied;lingering dryish hoppy and citrus-fruity finish. Gorgeous stuffand more a Bohemian than a german Pilsener!

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 Tap. Pale golden, big bright white lacing head. Nice green, light sulphuric, citric grassy and earthy hop nose. Mellow sparkly body. Crisp bright, not as herbal as other wet hop brews, really nice.

Bottle 330ml.Light unclear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass, green hops, fresh hops. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, gren hops, grassy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121219]
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is yellow. Aroma and taste are rich hops, grass, straw, malt and notes of sugar. Long bitter finish. Yummy!
Bottle @ home. Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. ry and rather bitter finish. 280213
Pale golden body wuth a froathy, tall white persistent white head. Herbal aroma. Taste is of a normal pils, with a hoppier feel. Not bad at all

Bottled; thanks fonefan.  Cloudy pale golden, Intense aroma of fresh spicy hops. Dry and slender with crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Spicy hops dominate, really bitter finish. Very refreshing top of the line pilsener.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a cloudy golden with a dense and lacing white head with a good retention. Lovely herbal hop aroma, quite some yeast also. Medium body, slightly sweet initially and then good and spicy hops. Not all that bitter though. Excellent! 200213

33 cl bottle @Il Cantuccio pub, Legro di Orta, Italy. Pours a hay-yellow coloured, crystal clear liquid, with a massive fluffy white head. Problems with the yeast, since I was expecting some nice grassy/floral hops aroma, and I found that the only smell coming out was sulphur, leaving an almost unperceivable trace of the hops. Taste was ok, dry and bitter with a touch of honey/bread from the malt, correctly carbonated, but having the nose in the glass made drinking this a most unpleasant experience,
Bottle. Trade with Fonefan. Pours clear yellow with a creamy White head. Lots of fresh Grassy hops. Hayish and Bready. Crisp, hoppy and dry. Lovely!
Dunkel hopfiger Beginn, weich. Im Mittelteil schwächer, dabei konstant hopfig. Dunkler werdend, süffig. Gut. 9/11/10/9/11/9

The head is medium, the body blond. It smells grassy, hay, bitter, malty, aroamtic. The taste is interesting, hoppy, grassy-hoppy, CO², woody-fresh, later more mild and balanced. Interesting and good Idea, overall fruity, citrus-bitter, nice! 11/12/11/12/11/12

05/12/2012 La Tana (tap). Dorata, limpidissima, schiuma molto abbondante che ne compromette la spillatura. Al naso luppolo in forte evidenza, note di malto e miele, molto appagante e pulito rispetto ad altre pils tedesche. In bocca delude, malto e luppolo sono ben bilanciati ma larmonia è compromessa dalla gasatura ridotta (per via dei problemi di spillatura) e dalla presenza di diacetile. Pils interessante, ma purtroppo non in perfette condizioni.
Pilsener buonissima con un profilo aromatico di luppolo inusuale, gusto pieno e sostanzioso, molto appagante, non come le comune pils slavate

Il nome sulla mia bottiglia è "Grünhopfen Pils" . E davvero una buona birra! Bionda con un bel cappello di schiuma poco persistente. Aroma inizialmente luppolato e agrumato per poi riportarsi sui canoni tedeschi. Al palato moderatamente corposa con una buona dose di luppolatura, strutturata su una base di dolce che la rende imperdibile. Insomma: è buona, si fa bere, costa poco e aspetta solo che la mandate giù dal gargarozzo. Prosit

Tap @  YNWA, Kolding.
Pours bright yellow with a tiny, creamy, white film head. Aroma is fresh hops, very grassy, mld doughy malts in the back. Medium to high carbonation, fine dry grainy and somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is fairly straight-forward pilsner, light grainy and perhaps even wheaty in the doughy malts. Grassy and fairly nice lingering bitterness.

Draft as Grunhopfen Pils. A hazy golden beer with a huge white head. The aroma has notes of grass, hops, spices, and yeast. The flavor is sweet with notes of grass and hops, leading to a bitter finish. The mouthfeel is creamy smooth.

Chopp, "Grunhopfen Pils", mug. Pale to hazy yellow colour with a big white well alsting creamish like head, looks very nice. Aroma of herbal hops. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is fresh and hoppy, herbal, fruitish like. Good bitterness, dry.
From tap at Ølbaren as Grunhopfen  Pils, 5%. pours pale yellow, hazy yellow with a huge white head. aroma is fruity and grassy. grassy and citrusy. mild fruity and crisp hoppy grassy.
